answers.answer: I was diagnosed with diabetes  when I was 12 years old (2002).I remember my symptoms very vividly.  Some of my red-flags were:drinking A LOT of water, Peeing  very often (both of these have to do with a very high blood sugar.  Your body wants to get rid of this excess sugar by flushing it out with water), sleeping all day and night, no energy.If your daughter has type 1 diabetes it is hereditary, which means her weight has nothing to do with it.  It may be more likely that your daughter has type 1 because she is at a younger age.  Type 1 is also called juvenile diabetes.  If your daughter has type 2 diabetes it is caused by an unhealthy lifestyle and and unhealthy weight.  Either way both types are completely manageable if your daughter does in fact have diabetes.  There also insulin pumps now availiable which makes managing type 1 much easier!You remind me of my mother and you sound like a very caring person.  No matter what the outcome is, your support will mean everything!Take Care and Good Luck!
